documents.document:
Catering To Various Purses Efficiently

Kumarakom is a tiny village located near Kottayam, in Kerala. Kumarakom is actually a cluster of small islands in Vembanad Backwaters. Kumarakom is now a popular tourism destination. Scores throng to it, to savor the exquisiteness of Backwater tourism.
Backwaters are an exclusive Kerala occurrence. It is a complex network of manmade and natural canals and inlets, estuaries of over forty rivers and five lakes. Before ferries, bridges and roads came, this was the transportation means of local people. They depended for their livelihood on Backwaters.
Kumarakom is the epitome of the exquisiteness that backwater landscape is. In Kumarakom Backwaters is mainly formed by Meenachil river and Vembanad Lake. Kumarakom is endowed with exotic fauna and flora, lush paddy fields, coconut trees, mangrove forests and bustling activities of life. Besides that, there is a Bird sanctuary in Kumarakom. It spreads about fourteen acres and has come up with the preservation efforts of Kerala Government. Many migratory birds especially Siberian Crane frequent the bird sanctuary. Kumarakom is thus frequented by naturalists, honeymooners and ordinary tourists.
Catering to this inflow many hotels and resorts have come up. Kumarakom hotels and Kumarakom resorts line up the shores of backwaters, majestically overlooking it. Kumarakom hotels are renowned for the high class accommodation facilities they offer and also for the quality of service rendered by the staff. They treat guests with all warmth and hospitality with a winning smile. Beautifully decorated luxury rooms with lot of space are hallmarks of hotels of Kumarakom. Now also catering to middle end and low end tourists many cheap hotels and budget hotels have come up in Kumarakom.
Cheap hotels Kumarakom may give you a chance to experience local lifestyle in its fullest. Although hotels of higher end also cater to this urge of tourists to feel the local, it may be hampered by the luxurious amenities provided. Budget Hotels in Kumarakom offer facilities and service on par with luxury hotels in a reasonable purse. The hotels in Kumarakom also provide for twenty four hours running hot and cold water, Business centre, Direct dialing and wireless Internet services, Laundry and dry clean facilities, Multi cuisine Restaurant, Recreational centre, Safe deposit Box, Spacious parking facilities, Currency exchange facilities, twenty four hour security etc.
Some hotels in Kumarakom have ayurvedic spas as an added amenity. Some also hire out facilities to business segment for conferences, meetings and training programmes.
Hotels in Kumarakom arrange for houseboat cruises. Houseboats are modern day versions of yesteryear “Kettuvallams”. “Kettuvallams” were used as transportation means through backwaters. They had thatched roof over wooden hulls to offer protection from elements of nature. Although the shape remains same, Houseboats are two to three storied affairs. Houseboats are also luxurious affairs with fulltime airconditioning. There is dining space, sleeping space and sit out open on all sides letting guests savor the backwaters. A crew including a cook accompanies the guests. Spending a night docked in Backwaters will be a blissful experience. You can get the local feel by switching off electricity and spending time on light of lanterns alone.
Hotels in Kumarakom arrange facilities for boating, yachting and fishing for the tourists who could do so savoring the panoramic beauty encircling the lake. They can also witness various types of Race boats like “Churulan”, “Odi”, “Iruttukuthi” and “Chundan”.
For more information about How to Reach Kumarakom and Kumarakom Backwaters or visit our site www.kumarakomhotels.org.in .

Experience the Heavenly Attractions by Staying In Exclusive

Holidays have always been the finest way to get unwind or it is the best way to spend some beautiful moments with family and friends, but how would you feel when you get all the attractions in a single destination, yes we are talking about none other than Kanyakumari one of the finest town in the state of Tamil Nadu in India. Nature has gifted this town with such stunning attractions whose significance is just beyond the words and visual delight. It is undoubtedly a beautiful town and a well-renowned Hindu Pilgrimage site popularly called Cape Camorin located at the edge of Indian Peninsula. About the location of this place it is just at a distance of around 86 km from Thiruvananthapuram, the capital city of God’s Own Country Kerala. It is however a pilgrimage city but in terms of natural attractions and sightseeing spots it places on the top of world tourist map.

From refreshing hills, mesmerizing waterfalls, tropical greenery, palm-fringed beaches, to ranges of floras and faunas, it offers every thing to the nature lovers. The name of Kanyakumari is derived after the Kanyakumari temple dedicated to kumari Amman. This temple is among the popular Kanyakumari tourist attractions. Being the point of intersection for the Bay of Bengal, Indian Ocean and the Arabian Sea, it is an important place tourist map of India. Due to several attractions and sightseeing spots it is well associated with hotels and good accommodations. All the Kanyakumari hotels are set strategically with great features and offer all the world amenities to the visitors and give them unforgettable holidaying experience.

Whether you are nature-lover or either visiting there with spiritual purpose, there wouldn’t be any better place than Kanyakumari, truly a paradise for every kind of visitors. Over the years, this town has also emerged as a prominent centre for art, culture and religion. World-famous spiritual leader Swami Vivekananda had spent several days at this place. There are so many reasons that why anyone should chose this place as their tourist destination. Among many the prime reason to select this place as their holidaying destination is that it is very small and can be explored within very few times.

The major attraction in Kanyakumari is its temples as there are so many temples famous for their architectural beauty magnets tourists from every nook and corner of the world. Tourism has been rise in Kanyakumari during the 1970’s. Among many places of tourists interest the main temple of Kanyakumari is also an important tourist site encourage tourist to visit there during visiting and exploring this place. Apart from Vivekananda Rock Memorial is another attraction of tourists interest built on the rock in 1970, amidst the sea, is the memorial that comprises a meditation hall.

A boat service from the shore will take you the place where Swami Vivekananda sat on a long mediation. Well there are many other attractions of tourist’s interest having their distinctive features and if you wish to explore all of them and looking for a perfect staying with all facilities but at the same time do not want do any compromise with your pocket then must head to budget hotels in Kanyakumari.

For more information about Kanyakumari sunset, Kanyakumari Hotels, Kanyakumari Sunset and Budget Hotels in Kanyakumari or visit our site http://kanyakumarihotels.org.in/.

Havens in the land of Kanyakumari

Kanyakumari is one of the few places in the world where one can witness both the sunset and sunrise at same beach because of its peculiar geography. This particular fact and host of other attractions make Kanyakumari a hot tourism destination. Millions horde to the place in anticipation of savoring the exquisite charms of the place.
Kanyakumari, sometimes referred to as Cape Comorin, is a town in Tamil Nadu of South India. Located at the southernmost tip of the Indian Peninsula, it is the geographical end of the Indian mainland. Kanyakumari lies at the converging point of three bodies of water – Arabian Sea, Bay of Bengal and Indian Ocean and is the terminating point of Western Ghats and Eastern Ghats. Kanyakumari takes its name from the Kumari Amman or Kanyakumari Temple, situated in the town, on the sea-shore.
Catering to the steady flow of tourists to Kanyakumari many hotels have come up in Kanyakumari. Hotels in Kanyakumari can be classified into ultimate luxury variety to budget hotels. The luxury variety make for spacious, luxurious rooms with modern décor to be provided to the tourists. Like the accommodation facilities, quality of service rendered is also of superlative quality. Kanyakumari hotels guarantee round the clock quality service. The staff encounters the guests with a disarming smile with all the warmth and hospitality. The hotels are adjoined with multi cuisine restaurants with delicious menu provided in various styles from Continental to Chinese.
Apart from high class accommodation facilities and quality service, hotels provide hot and cold water running round the clock, Banquet hall, conference hall, meeting hall, amenities for indoor and outdoor games, Doctors on call, twenty four hours security, spacious parking facilities and travel desk services.
Kanyakumari is an egalitarian sort of tourist destination. People of various sects and from economic strata visit the place. Catering to budget minded guests there are budget hotels available. Budget hotels in Kanyakumari provide for excellent accommodation facilities and quality service coming in an economic purse.
Hotels in Kanyakumari rent out facilities to business sects to conduct conferences, meetings and training programmes. With the opportunity to see sun rise and sun set and other places of significance on the offer there is a rush to participate in the events.
Viewing sun rise and sun set in Kanyakumari is a fascinating affair very high on tourist ratings. Word of mouth has spread throughout the world about it. The sky make for picturesque setting and the sunrays falling in the sea waters reflecting in multi colors is plain bliss. Experienced people recommend the beach at Vivekandapuram as the ideal spot to view the sun set and sun rise.
Other important things to be viewed in Kanyakumari are Vivekanda Rock, Vivekandapuram, Statue of Thiruvalluvar, Our Lady of Ransom Church, temple of goddess Kanyakumari, Padmanabhapuram Palace, Kamarajar Mani Mantapa Monument, Baywatch and Tsunami Monument.
Vivekanda Rock is about hundred meters from the shore and has a regular ferry service connecting them. It is believed that Swami Vivekanda meditated here. The rock has two ‘mandapas” – one belonging to Swami Vivekananda and the other has a foot shaped carving on the rock. It is believed to be the foot mark of Goddess Kumari. It is also an ideal spot to view sun rise and sun set.
Thiruvalluvar Statue is dedicated to arguably the greatest Tamil poet, philosopher, and saint Thiruvalluvar.
For more information about on Kanyakumari Hotels, Hotels in Kanyakumari, Sunste in Kanyakumari and Budget Hotels in Kanyakumari or visit our site http://kanyakumarihotels.org.in/.

Explore Stunning Kumarakom by Staying In Budget Hotels

There are so many tourist destinations world-wide having their great features but none is like as Kerala world-renowned to as ‘God’s Own Country’ located at south-western part of India. Well if you are looking for any kind of vacations right from honeymoon, family holiday, culture to adventure, look no further than this state which is just beyond the words and visual delight. It is an ideal holidaying spot for those who really wish to spend some moments in the lap of mother-nature. Refreshing hills, palm-fringed beaches, pristine lagoons, wildlife parks and picturesque backwaters makes it one of the in the entire planet.

Along with its natural treasures it is equally admired for its fascinating culture, friendly people, exotic food and excellent hotels and Ayurvedic resorts gives world class amenities to the visitors give them unforgettable holidaying experience. Kerala is bestowed with innumerable attractions and destinations as it is the largest state by size but among all of them Kumarakom is the most visited destination by visitors well illustrated in ‘God of Small Things’ a perfect novel written by booker prize winner Arundhati Roy. The place Kumarakom is well famous for its scenic landscapes and tranquil backwaters that to explore them you can stay at Kumarakom hotels set strategically along the perfect backdrop of nature.

Lush green meadows, magnificent churches, rustic villages and amazing topography, all make it the finest places in the world. Well there are many other things to observe in this place but most of the visitors visit this place just to explore its stunning backwaters as backwater houseboat Kumarakom tour takes tourists in the beautiful world of water and wonders.

Several rivers, lakes, inlets and lagoons merge up together and form the breathtaking locale that can be well-experienced through country’s houseboats also known as Kettuvallams in traditional language gives all the facilities to the visitors and leave them spell bound. Houseboats were used as the major source of transportation but now have become the major part of state tourism. The essential features of houseboats include bath-attached rooms, lounge, deck, kitchenette and many more. Be here, hire any houseboat and experience its breathtaking attractions while enjoying its soothing climatic conditions as Kumarakom climate is moderate throughout the year and so it is also an important feature of this picturesque village, tempts great number of visitors from every nook and corner of the world.

Apart from its scenic backwaters, if there is any thing which really tempts tourists most then its national bird sanctuary home to innumerable, colourful birds and marine animals gives real enjoyment to the visitors. The major attractions in Kumarakom include waterfowl, cuckoo, owl, egret, heron and the water duck, as well as the migratory Siberian cranes. Located just 12km from Kottayam, it is among the finest bird sanctuaries in India. Due to the huge arrival of tourists in Kumarakom, local government has given special attention on hotels and accommodations of the visitors as there are ranges of hotels such as luxury, cheap, standards and budget hotels in Kumarakom fits to every range of tourists.

For more information Budget Hotels in Kumarakom and Backwater Houseboat Kumarakom or visit our site www.kumarakomhotels.org.in .

Kanyakumari Hotels – Havens in an ancient city

Kanyakumari has been a city of ancient culture and heritage. It perhaps represents all the beautiful things India has to offer to the world. One may find many temples, churches, religious pillars and statues which speaks volumes about the mixed culture of Kanyakumari. Kanyakumari is also the place where one can witness sunrise and sunset from the same spot because of its geographical peculiarity. Kanyakumari derived its name from the gorgeous Kanyakumari temple situated on the sea shore.
Kanyakumari is located at the southernmost tip of the Indian Peninsula. It is considered the geographical end of Indian mainland. Three bodies of water – Arabian Sea, Bay of Bengal and Indian Ocean converge at Kanyakumari. It is also the terminating points of Western Ghats and Eastern Ghats. Kanyakumari is a small town in the state of Tamil Nadu in India. It is also sometimes referred to as Cape Comorin.
Due to its various attractions, millions of tourists throng to Kanyakumari. Kanyakumari homes enough infrastructure to accommodate and serve the tourist inflow towards it. Its hotels come in standard, luxury, budget and cheap varieties. Kanyakumari Hotels provide excellent accommodation facilities and quality of service to its guests. The rooms are spacious, luxurious and embellished with modern décor. They maintain a pious and serene atmosphere which is true to the character of Kanyakumari. A very knowledgeable staff caters to the guests taking extra care that none of their queries are left unanswered and their demands are met to the maximum possible extent. They serve with an enchanting smile with all warmth and hospitality. There are multi cuisine restaurants adjoined to the hotels which serve scrumptious menu of various styles from Chinese to continental.
Another important aspect of Kanyakumari hotels is that there is provision to see the sunrise and sunset from the hotels itself. You can also have the scenery of sea from the hotels. But most prefer to have the glimpse of sunrise and sunset from beach and other vantage points.
Apart from high class accommodation facilities and quality service, hotels provide hot and cold water running round the clock, Banquet hall, conference hall, meeting hall, amenities for indoor and outdoor games, Doctors on call, twenty four hours security, spacious parking facilities and travel desk services.
Due to the special place Kanyakumari have in heart of Indian people, there are many types of tourists arriving at Kanyakumari. Some are on a shoestring budget. Budget hotels in Kanyakumari cater to the segment that does not have a lot of money to spare. They offer excellent facilities and quality of service in a budgeted purse.
The hotels of Kanyakumari also rent out facilities to Business class to conduct conferences, meetings and training programmes.
Vivekanda Rock Memorial is an important tourist attraction of Kanyakumari. It is about hundred meters from the shore and a regular ferry service connects it with mainland. The rock has two ‘Mandaps’ (halls)- one belonging to Swami Vivekananda and other homes a holy foot. This foot mark is believed that to be of goddess Kumari. The rock memorial has a tall statue of Swami Vivekanda. You can see both sunrise and sunset from here and there is a heavy rush of visitors.
Thiruvalluvar statue is another prominent tourist attraction. It is dedicated to Thiruvalluvar who is considered greatest of Tamil poets, philosophers and saints.
For more information Kanyakumari sunset, Budget Hotels in Kanyakumari or visit our site http://kanyakumarihotels.org.in/.

Kanyakumari Hotels – Havens in Temple Town

Kanyakumari is a temple town in the state of Tamilnadu of southern India. It got its name from the temple of Kanyakumari which is scenically located on the shores of the sea. It is also a place where one can witness sunrise and sunset from the same spot due to its geographical peculiarity. Kanyakumari also has been a city of ancient culture and heritage. It also homes many interesting sights surrounding it.
Kanyakumari, named Cape Comorin by British, is located at the southernmost tip of Indian peninsula. It is the geographical end of Indian mainland. Kanyakumari is situated at the confluence of three bodies of water – Arabian Sea, Bay of Bengal and Indian Ocean. It is the terminating point of Western Ghats and Eastern Ghats.
Lured by its many attractions many visit Kanyakumari. Catering to this steady inflow, many hotels have come up in Kanyakumari. Most of the hotels in Kanyakumari are by the sides of water and offer an opportunity to witness sunrise and sunset. The accommodation facilities and quality of service on offer are excellent. The rooms on offer are luxurious, spacious and with modern amenities. The designs are lavishly elegant. Staff encounters guests with an enchanting smile armed with all warmth and hospitality. They answer all the queries of guests with politeness. All the demands of them are attended to with maximum care and adhered to the maximum possible extent. The compliments that are in the visitor’s book for the staff speak volumes about the satisfaction level of guests. They are adjoined with multi cuisine restaurants serving sumptuous menu of variety cuisines. The styles vary from Chinese to continental.
Apart from luxurious rooms with modern amenities, quality service and multi cuisine restaurants, hotels in Kanyakumari offers hot and cold running water, round the clock room service, twenty four hours check in and check out, Cable television, direct dialing, Doctor on call, laundry service, travel desks, safety lockers, Money exchange, life facilities, Open lawn services, valet car parking, baby sitting, secretarial services, postal service etc.
Kanyakumari hotels come in various categories – Luxury, standard, budget and cheap. Budget hotels provide excellent facilities and service for a reasonable budget. Cheap hotels in Kanyakumari cater to tourists travelling on a shoe string budget.
Most hotels are adjoined with Ayurveda treatment spas and yoga centers. The fragrance of ayurveda and yoga has reached far and wide leading to increased demand for these facilities.
Kanyakumari hotels also rent out facilities to business class to conduct conferences, meetings and training programmes. The opportunity to witness sunrise and sunset is a big attraction to participants.
The reputation of Kanyakumari sunset is overwhelming. You can have the glimpse of sun set from the hotels itself. But the tourists prefer to be in beaches and most preferably in Vivekananda rock. They wait eagerly to witness the sun sets into the ocean and the sky turns crimson. Some are equipped with cameras to record the magnificent sight. On a particular day one may witness sunset and moon rise at the same time. This pleasant full moon day is locally called Chithra Pournami.
Vivekanda Rock temple is an important tourist attraction of Kanyakumari. The rock has two ‘Mandaps’ (halls)- one belonging to Swami Vivekananda and other homes a foot mark, believed that to be of goddess Kumari.

For more information about Kanyakumari sunset, Cheap Hotels in Kanya Kumari or visit our site http://kanyakumarihotels.org.in/.

Discover Kumarakom and experience its mysterious beauty

Kerala is undoubtedly one of the finest holidaying destinations in the world, famous for its natural virgin attractions and amazing destinations. Considered an ideal place for nature-lovers, it offers all the mesmerizing attractions of nature in the form of scenic backwaters, palm-fringed beaches, wildlife national parks and invigorating hill stations. All the attractions of Kerala are extremely beautiful and worth to be explored in a lifetime span. Along with its natural attractions this god’s abode is equally popular for its unique culture, exotic resorts, well-cultured people and excellent hotels and resorts.
Kerala is home to the innumerable attractions and amazing destinations and Kumarakom is among them one of the finest places to explore. The small cluster of island, Kumarakom is well-renowned for its breathtaking beauty and tranquility. The significance and splendor of this place is well mentioned in the ‘God of Small Things’, a world-renowned novel written by booker prize winner Arundhati Roy. Every year from different parts of the world, people visits this place in a great numbers just to glimpse the several enchanting colors of nature.
This town is extremely stunning and it’s really tough to decide what part should be explored and what not but tourists here mostly visited for its scenic backwaters which made up with the perfect combination of brackish lagoons, lakes, inlets and several rivers. Backwaters of this town are extremely beautiful and worth to explore at least once in a lifetime span but however it is not possible even without houseboats also known as Kettuvallams in traditional language. Backwater houseboat Kumarakom is the best way to experience nature by close as it takes tourists in the stunning world of water and wonderments. The houseboat is well-organized and offers all the world class facilities to the visitors including bath-attached rooms, lounge, deck, and many more.
Apart from its scenic, calm backwaters if there is any other thing which draws the attention of visitors then it’s National Bird Sanctuary which is home to the ranges of species of birds as well as marine animals. If you are bird lover and wish to catch their every moment then it would be finest place to get in. some of the species that can be found in Kumarakom bird sanctuary include waterfowl, kingfisher, turtle, cuckoo, owl, egret, heron, water duck and many more. This place is not less than paradise for those who love bird-watching. Though, you can visit every time of the year but to gaze innumerable species of birds or migratory birds June to August would be appropriate. By staying in Kumarakom hotels you can well experienced to this place set strategically in the perfect setting of nature.
Apart from, Kumarakom climate which is mostly remains cool mild draws the attention of visitors while visiting this place. Very closer to the sea this place enjoys mild climate all the year round. Heavy rains are in June and August due to the south west monsoon. A winter commences from December and continues till February.
Well if you are visiting with limited budget and do not wish to compromise with your pocket any more then you can choose the budget hotels in Kumarakom.
For more information about Budget Hotels in Kumarakom and Backwater Houseboat Kumarakom or visit our site www.kumarakomhotels.org.in .

Explore the heart of ‘God’s Own Country’, Kumarakom

World renowned ‘God’s Own Country’ Kerala is undoubtedly one of the finest tourists destination located at south-western part of India. If someone has desire to know its significance in single word then we would pronounce it heaven. It is one such a state where one can experience the presence of god as it is bestowed with innumerable virgin attractions of nature. It is considered a finest tourist destination for those who wish to spend their vacations in the lap of mother-nature. Refreshing hill stations, picturesque backwaters, palm-fringed beaches and invigorating hill stations are the major assets of the green paradise Kerala. Along with its breath-taking attractions it is equally popular for its unique culture, exotic food, and excellent hotels and accommodations.
Among several attractions of Kerala, houseboat backwater tours are getting very popular in this state persuades all kind of tourists to visit there different parts of the world. While talking about the picturesque backwaters of the state, how we can forget Kumarakom a small cluster of islands, famous with its scenic landscapes and virgin attractions, draws the attention of many to visit there at least once in a lifetime span.
Every year tourists from every nook and corner of the world visit this place in a great number just to catch the glimpse of nature by close. The significance and splendor of this place is just beyond the words and visual descriptions. Once you visit to this place you will indeed think that while creating this place god has done enough partiality as it offers everything to the nature-lovers.
Several rivers, lagoons, lakes, inlets and many teams up together and form the breathtaking backwaters that can be only experienced through Kumarakom houseboatsthe single way to explore the scenic backwaters. In earlier times houseboats were only used for the transportation purpose carries one thing to another place but later it modified with all the facilities and in present times it offers all the luxuries to the visitors.
Houseboats are designed after considering all kind of tourists in mind offers all the luxuries to the visitors including bat-attached rooms, lounge, deck, kitchenette, along with cruise member’s team. Houseboats in Kumarakom takes tourists in the stunning world of water and wonders and leave them spellbind. Due to its closeness with sea the climate here most of the time remains moderate but winters enjoy blissful climatic conditions and enhance its magnetism.
While on Kumarakom backwater journey tourists not only explore the stunning natural attractions but at the same time they will have an opportunity to experience the rural life of Keralalitie’s. The attractions that can be explored during backwater cruise in Kumarakom include scenic landscapes, palm-fringed beaches, magnificent churches, exotic resorts, lush green vegetation and bird sanctuary.
Apart from stunning backwaters if there is another thing that enhances the popularity of this place then its Kumarakom national bird sanctuary home to the colorful birds and marine animals. Located on the banks of Vembanad Lake and considered an essential part of Kumarakom packages, this bird is also known as ornithologist’s paradise.
For more information about Kumarakom packages and Kumarakom Backwater or visit our site http://www.kumarakomhouseboats.org.in/.

Honeymoon Redefined With The Enchanting Backwaters And The L

Located on the Malabar Coast of south west India Kerala is home to the enchanting backwaters and the evergreen vast tea estates. The state of Kerala with its exquisite beauty and splendor has been the attraction of many tourists and honeymoon couples since time immemorial.
With Kerala Honeymoon trip enjoy the lazily flowing backwaters cutting through the beautiful landscape lined with an array of coconut trees, the sun playing hide and seek over the top of coconut trees, the whispering winds bowing through your hair, soft lapping sounds of the water breaking against the boat, sweet silence of nature with occasional cries of the birds and just you and your beloved on a honeymoon unforgettable.
The enchanting backwaters with its canals flowing along the landscape are just like Venice’s romantic canals and all lovers know that Venice and romance is synonymous. Thus these backwaters are rightfully termed as the Indian Venice. With Kerala honeymoon tours enjoy the best romantic backwaters here such as:-

Kumarakom- on the Vembanad Lake a small huddle of islands lies the village of Kumarakom. This enchanted backwater destination with a bird sanctuary that spans over 14 acres of land is a hotspot for different variety of migratory birds too. Cruise along with your beloved on the calm backwaters of Kumarakom and witness colourful migratory birds that flock the place.
Also to enjoy here is the leisure sport of fishing wherein you can land a fish with your loved one. There are also independent cottages that have been built on stilts among the vast coconut groves by the Kerala tourism development corporation. The panoramic backwaters and the traditional green rice barges known as Kettuvalloms is a sight seen nowhere else in the world.
Alappuhza- enjoy the lazing backwater cruise on a houseboat floating towards the Vembanad Lake. Let your eyes set upon the scenic views that reign this place and take in the beauty of nature slowly arm in arm with your loved one. The route to Vembanad Lake dotted with small villages from where you can see small children with huge smiles waving at you as you pass by them. The green waters with sunlight playing over them occasionally breaking up into miniscule rainbows when it passes through the drops of water dripping from the oars will enchant you with the simplicity and beauty of nature.

Vaikom- as you take a tour towards Vaikom on your houseboat you will find a small island called Pathiramanal afloat the great backwaters. The refreshing greenery here will relax and rejuvenate you with the simple but enigmatic beauty it possesses. Also to be noted here is the great temple which is dedicated to the god of destruction Lord Shiva.
After your cruises on the great backwaters a bit of walking around amidst the hills of Munnar that is famous for its tea gardens would be a contrasting experience altogether. This beautiful hill of Munnar with its picturesque views and lush green tea gardens does not in any way lag behind in beauty with the backwaters. With Munnar honeymoon packages, experience a honeymoon like no other in these lush green hills.
All in all with Kerala honeymoon you will have the most romantic settings at your disposal. A stay here with the scenic backwaters and picturesque hills will make your honeymoon much more romantic than you would have imagined. Come visit the commonly known Gods Own Country and rest assured this honeymoon will be the best time of your life.

For more information about Kerala Honeymoonand Kerala Honeymoon Tours or visit our site http://www.keralahoneymoonpackages.org.in/.

Visit Kumarakom offers thrilling backwater houseboat cruise

There are so many attractions and destinations world-wide but Kerala has its own significance fascinates all kind of visitors from every nook and corner of the world. Often referred as God’s abode, Kerala is undoubtedly one of the finest tourist destination located at southern part of India. It is one such place where one can observe almost every color of nature in the form of refreshing hill stations, picturesque backwaters, wildlife national parks and ranges of floras and faunas. Every year from across the world, people visit this state in a great numbers just to observe every color of nature by close.
Along with its natural eye-catching attractions, it is equally popular for its unique culture, exotic resorts, well-cultured people and excellent hotels and accommodations offer all the facilities to the visitors. Among several places of tourist’s interest, Kumarakom is one of the most visited places by visitors well-renowned with its scenic backwaters which are worth to explore at least once in a lifetime span. Several lakes, lagoons, inlets or many identified or unidentified rivers make picturesque backwaters that can be well-experienced through houseboats also known as Kettuvallams in traditional language.
Backwaters tours Kumarakom Kerala takes tourists in the stunning world of water and wonderments and just leave them spellbind. Backwaters of this place are well-renowned for its picturesque locales and tranquility that can be only experienced through well-organized houseboats. Or in other words houseboats are only the way to experience the splendor of backwaters offers all the facilities to the visitors which are really not less than any luxury hotel. Some of the best features of houseboats include bath-attached rooms, lounge, deck, kitchenette and many more.
No matters with what budget are you visiting, as there are different Kumarakom houseboat packages renders different facilities to different kind of visitors. There are several houseboats with distinctive facilities promises tourists a memorable holidaying experience. Luxury, semi-luxury, deluxe, standard and etc are the few categories of houseboats.
Houseboats tours Kumarakomtakes tourists in the stunning world of water and wonders and leave them spellbind. On your houseboat cruise in Kumarakom tourists you will not only have an opportunity to gaze all the colors of nature by close but at the same time you will have an opportunity to explore the several colorful birds by close. Kumarakom bird sanctuary is one of the major attractions of this place and of course an essential part of any holiday packages.
Well if you love birds and want to see them into their or original habitats, then you must visit to this bird sanctuary, one of the prominent bird sanctuaries in India. Comes among finest bird sanctuaries in world, this bird sanctuary is located 12km from Kottayam in Kerala. Some of the finest species of birds that can be found in this stunning bird sanctuary include waterfowl, cuckoo, owl, egret, heron water duck, as well as the migratory Siberian cranes.
Well if you decided to visit this place and have concern regarding houseboat booking in Kumarakom then you don’t to bother about it, you can do it online or either can contact with our leading tour operators.

Kerala Honeymoon Tours and Holidays

Located in the serene ambiance of the nature, the land of God’s own Country, Kerala is amazingly gifted with serene and alluring tourism attractions. It is the land of scenic beauty and holds some of the finest attractions and places of tourist interest that makes the tours more enjoyable and memorable.

Apart from magnetic backwaters if is there any other thing that adds the popularity of the place then Kumarakom Weather which is generally remains moderate and cool. The summers are warm, with temperatures soaring up to 38 degrees during the day time but winters are very cool with the temperature about 18 deg C.

Kanyakumari Hotels – Situated Among Grand Culture

Kanyakumari boasts of being a prominent place of pilgrimage, culture and architectural wealth from ancient times. It homes a mixed culture and profound heritage. In fact it is a pilgrimage site for many religions and this influence of multiple religions is seen in the architectural heritage of the city.
Kanyakumari is also the place where Indian mainland ends. It is washed by three water bodies- Arabian Sea, Bay of Bengal and Indian Ocean. Kanyakumari is peculiar in that it is possible to glimpse sunrise and sunset from there. There are also many attractive sightseeing sites also in Kanyakumari.
Kanyakumari is a prime tourism destination which attracts scores of tourists because of these attractions. There is a thriving hospitality industry in Kanyakumari which takes care of the millions who throng to it. Kanyakumari hotels come in various varieties – standard, luxury, budget and cheap. There are also five star, four star and three star segments of hotel. The luxury hotels of Kanyakumari offer posh accommodation facilities and number one quality round the clock service. The rooms provided are luxurious, spacious and adorned with modern décor. The staff is knowledgeable and encounters guests with a disarming smile sprinkled with oodles of warmth and hospitality. They listen to guests with politeness and attentiveness. Demands of the guests are met to the maximum possible extent promptly. Hotels of Kanyakumari are adjoined with multi cuisine restaurants which provide for scrumptious menu of various styles from Chinese to continental.
Apart from high class accommodation facilities, quality service and multi cuisine restaurants, hotels provide hot and cold water running round the clock, Banquet hall, conference hall, meeting hall, amenities for indoor and outdoor games, Doctors on call, twenty four hours security, spacious parking facilities and travel desk services.
Kanyakumari is a place visited by all sorts of people from various strata of society. Hospitality industry of Kanyakumari is wise enough to cater to them all. Budget hotels in Kanyakumari cater to those travelers who do not have large amount of money to spare. They provide above par accommodation facilities and quality service on a budgeted purse.
Most hotels of Kanyakumari are situated near the sea and provide for arrangements to see sunrise and sunset from them. But most people prefer to savor sunrise and sunset from the sea shore or other destinations than from the hotel rooms. Some hotels publicize the views of Kanyakumari tourist attractions from the hotels as their selling point.
The hotels in Kanyakumari offer their facilities on rent to Business segments to host conferences, training programmes and meetings. The allurement of various sightseeing options and also magnificent sunrise and sunset provides for high attendance.
Kanyakumari got its name from the gorgeous temple of Goddess Kanyakumari scenically located on the sea shore. It is also known as Cape Comorin as named by British. Apart from the temple of Goddess Kanyakumari, the other attractions are Vivekanda Rock Memorial, Vivekandapuram, Statue of Thiruvalluvar, Our Lady of Ransom Church, Padmanabhapuram Palace, Kamarajar Mani Mantapa Monument, Baywatch and Tsunami Monument.
Vivekanada Rock is situated about hundred meters from the shore. Regular ferry service exists between mainland jetty and rock. The rock has two ‘mandaps’ or halls – one belonging to Swami Vivekanada and other to a print of foot. That footprint is said to be that of Goddess Kumari who offered a penance there.

Houseboats in Kerala and the serene backwaters are the crowning glory of the Kerala tourism which easily boost the beauty and tourism in the state. Honeymooners along with the other vacationers truly go crazy as the reveal and take pleasure ride on the well organized Kerala houseboats which swiftly moves over the Kerala backwaters.
Tourists from every nook and corner of the world refer the houseboat as the ‘moving home’ or ‘mobile home’ which provides all the comforts and luxuries like that off a home, far away from home. Kerala home to numerous backwaters and houseboats is also blessed by the divine of nature and truly can be explored as you enjoy the celestial cruise in the houseboats which earlier was called as ‘Kettuvallams’.
Kerala houseboat earlier was the only means of transportation of rice, grain and other products from one centre to another important centre. As the roads where invented and the existing of vehicles had the Kettuvallams out of the picture in Kerala. But, now the houseboats are back and with a bang as truly no visitor to Kerala ever miss the opportunity to enjoy the houseboat ride and exploring the wonderful nature, which never fail to impress the heart of the vacationers.

Honeymoon in the Cream of the Crop of Beautiful Kerala

The beautiful land of Kerela where religion, beauty and romance has found a haven has been the favorite haunt of honeymooning couples since ages. Blessed with emerald backwaters that flow serenely through the state enchanting all those who take a cruise on it, lush green tea estates with an aroma so pleasant that you get lost in the moment, the ancient caves with carvings that propel you into the by gone glorious days, the mesmerizing dance of Kathakali that spellbinds you with tales from epics, the scenic view of the majestic western ghats, flora and fauna that stirs curiosity and the long clean soft sand filled beaches all combine here to make it a honeymoon that is magical and passionate.

The best of places in this mystical land of beauty that will entice you and set ablaze the flames of romance are-

Thekkady- with the grand Periyar sanctuary within its bosom this place is a great place to relax and rejuvenate. A honeymoon in Thekkady is best enjoyed with a slow paddle boat ride in the Periyar Lake which is the largest manmade lake in Kerala. Enjoy a ride on this lake paddling slowly with your loved one with the beautiful songs of the birds resonating from the trees that surround it. Also keep an eye out toward the banks where you may see wild animals coming for a drink at the lake. Take a trip out into the tiger reserve and be amazed by the sheer number of animals that you will see lurking and grazing in the forests. A trip to this place will certainly deepen the bonds you share with your loved one as the memories created here will be simply awesome with all the wildlife you will see and the romantic boat ride in the lake.

Cochin- this is a place that is filled with quite a number of places to see. A honeymoon in Cochin should include the famed backwaters of Kerala, Santa Cruz Basilica, Mattancherry palace, hill palace of Tripunithura, church of St. Francis and Princess Street. These places are the star attractions of the city and a not visiting these places will make your trip to Cochin an incomplete one.

Kovalam- the name Kovalam stands true to its meaning as the place is filled with coconut trees, and the name also means a grove of coconut trees. The things to do when a honeymoon in Kovalam is planned would be the lighthouse beach from where the sunset seen is simply picturesque, speed boat rides here are simply awesome get on one of the speed boats and experience the thrill with your partner, walk along the pristine beaches hand in hand enjoying the fresh sea breeze and listen to the whispering of the coconut trees as the sway with the winds.

The above mentioned places are some of the best places in Kerala and a honeymoon taken here would be really romantic, relaxing and rejuvenating.

Excellent Hotels and Myriad Tourist Attractions to Explore

Kanyakumari is the most scenic place and is the extreme part of southern India. Situated in the southernmost tip of India this fascinating district of Tamil Nadu state, easily entice vacationers from all over the globe for amazing vacation. The majestic hills, virgin beaches, gushing rivers and the twisty rivulets easily allure the vacationers from all over the globe easily allure tourist from every nook and corner of the entire world. This wonderful destination is blown by the fragrance by the neighboring state Kerala, thus the custom, culture and architecture is mixed in rich deep traditions with that of Tamil Nadu.
This destination is truly very attractive and captivating which truly leave the vacationers spell bound on your visit to the fascinating district of Tamil Nadu. This place is associated with incredible men Mahatma Gandhi and Swami Vivekananda whose names memorial has been here. Truly the memorials are very worth to visit and explore and truly they add beauty to this scenic place.
Dotted with wonderful tourist attractions and destination this destination easily allures all the sorts of vacationers. Some of the major attractions and destinations which truly are very worth to visit and explore on their visit to Kanyakumari are listed below:
Vivekananda Rock Memorial
Vivekananda Rock Memorial is one of the most sacred monument and the admired tourist destination in this wonderful district of Kanyakumari. This is a wonderful fort on the island which beautifully stands on the top of a two rocks that are situated nearly 500 meters of the islands. This wonderful fort was built in the 1970’s on the two rocks which have been there from many days back. It is thought that the great philosopher Swami Vivekananda had meditated on the rock seeking enlightenment. Vivekananda Rock Memorial is open every day and attracts many visitors constantly. Kanyakumari hotels are easily accessible and truly it offers world class facilities which provide the visitors wonderful vacation.
Thiruvalluvar Statue
Thiruvalluvar is the immortal poet of Tamil Nadu & has given to the world Thirukkural. The memorial statue of Thiruvalluvar is in Kanyakumari. The pedestal of the statue is of 38 feet height & the statue over it is 95 feet tall with a grand total of 133 feet for the whole sculpture. The three tier pedestal known as Atharapeedam is surrounded by an artistic Mandapa known as Alankara Mandapa with 38 feet height. Surrounding the Alankara Mandapa stand ten elephant statues signifying 8 directions with earth & space down, which truly are sheer wonders to explore and visit. The sister of Sri Rama, the hero of Ramayana was called Dasaratha as they could charioteer in0 directions. To help the tourists to worship the holy feet of Thiruvalluvar 140 steps are constructed inside the Mandapa.
Visiting to Kanyakumari would not be considered as very worth or complete one until you explore the sunset in Kanyakumari. It’s truly a desire of dream for the vacationers and is answered as they explore and truly get lost in it. Beside these there numerous beaches and other attractions which truly lure the vacationers from all over the globe. Budget hotels in Kanyakumari are beautifully supplemented and are easily accessible so that no vacationers has problem as on their stay in this picturesque place.

Are you planning for vacations and looking for an exotic holidaying destination if yes then look no further than Kanyakumari, a sub-continental place in India known for its richness in culture and tradition. The name of this place has been christened after the virgin goddess Kanyakumari Amman. Mythological stories depict that lord Shiva wife Goddess Parvati under the disguise of Devi Kanniya did a penance in one of the rocks in this area to reach the hand of Lord Shiva. And this place is frequently visited by spiritual lovers as there are so many popular pilgrimages in this place.

Along with its several popular pilgrimages it is equally popular for its virgin natural attractions which also draws the attention of visitors. Munnar and Kovalam the Favorites of the Honeymooners in Kera

India has very beautiful places for tourists where tourists can enjoy their appreciated time with dear ones, all places have their own beauty, but Kerala tops the list of all the vacationers. Kerala is most beautiful tour destination of south-west India. It is land of coconut, is endless array of coconut palm. This destination is an inspiration for poet, writers, and singers and is perfect place for nature lovers. This beautiful state of India is gifted with unmatched beauty of hills station, picturesque backwaters, scenic beaches and it is also exotic destination for wildlife lovers. It is also known as ‘God’s own country’. You can find here all features which is important for tour destination. Honeymooners truly are very much enticed here and thus intense number of couples from all over the globe visit here to enjoy their romantic honeymoon.

Kerala is popular tour destination that means there are lots of features which attracts large numbers of tourists from all over the world. If you visit here you can see several spots which make your tour unforgettable. Kerala has 600 km shorelines bounded by the Arabian Sea and is known for its beautiful beaches in the world. Beaches are beautiful, clean and dotted by the coconut trees. There are some of the famous beaches that you must visit on your tour. These beaches has own beauty and charm. Visit these beaches and get a new surprise at your every step.

Some of the major and favoritehoneymoon places in Keralaand the favorite for the newlywed couples are such as listed below:

Kovalam Beach
Kovalam town is a scenic beach town which is located just 17 km away from Trivandrum which is blessed by the three stunning beaches which easily elate the vacationer’s heart. The swaying palm trees, tan sandy shores and the azure water easily attract all the vacationers for their exciting and fun filled vacation. Samudra, Hawa and Light House beaches are the three fascinating beaches which are very worth to visit and explore on your vacation. These beautiful beaches are amazingly bounded by the fascinating and excellent beach resorts, spa centers, hotels which offer wonderful accommodations. The honeymooner’s hearts are robbed by the splendid beauty of the beaches as on their honeymoon trip to Kerala.

Munnar
No, honeymoon in Kerala is ever considered as worth one until the enchanting beauty of Munnar with any Munnar honeymoon packages is explored. Munnar is most popular hill station in Kerala and is situated 1,600 meters above sea level. It is magnificent place in Kerala; large numbers of tourists visit here to enjoy scenic beauty and greenery. Apart from hills there are several attractions like tea gardens, flora, orange orchids and etc. Some of the magnificent spots to explore with any honeymoon packages in Munnar are such as Echo point, Rajamala, Pothamedu and Pallivasal. From the hill tourists can see all around greenery, picturesque beauty of nature, tea gardens, waterfall and other features. Truly the couples are sure to fall in love again with the grand beauty of this hill town which is lovingly called as ‘South of Kashmir’.

Top Romantic Honeymoon Destinations in Kerala

Cocooned in the heavenly atmosphere in South India, Kerala is enigmatically blessed with outstanding natural beauty and exciting sightseeing spots. It is gifted with so many romantic honeymoon places and so couples get wonderful opportunity to enjoy moments of sheer happiness and joy with immense pleasure and delights.
Well talking about the honeymoon tours in Kerala, couples can make the tour more enjoyable and memorable by the tailor made package that comes into various budgets. Honeymoon packages to Kerala comes into various budgets as Kerala has so many romantic honeymoon places and according to the places there comes packages that are tailor made available in all budgets. So if you want to make the honeymoon truly an experience of lifetime, just book the tailor made package and enjoy an everlasting memories to relish in forever and ever.
Some of the top romantic honeymoon places where couples can enjoy the Kerala honeymoon trip are highlighted below:
Munnar an Innocent Hill Station
Gifted with the outstanding natural beauty and exciting sightseeing spots, Munnar has come out with the top honeymoon destination visited by honeymooners from across the nook and corner of the globe. Some of the top romantic honeymoon spots to visit during Munnar honeymoon tours are Eravikulam National Park, Echo Point, CSI Christ Church, Blossom Garden and the sprawling ever ending tea gardens.
Kumarakom Backwater
If you want to enjoy honeymoon on a houseboat cruising over the picturesque backwaters, Kerala is perfect place. Created amazingly by the natural wonderments, the backwaters of Kerala are the perfect and the most sought after honeymoon destination where couples can enjoy the moments of joy in the solitude ambiance with immense pleasure and joy. Among the many backwater destinations, Kumarakom is considered to be the finest one as couples can celebrate the moments of joy but at the same time treasure remarkable memories to relish in forever and ever.
Beside these there are so many romantic honeymoon places in Kerala where couples can enjoy their dream holidays treasuring timeless memories to relish in forever and ever.

Enchanting Backwaters From Aboard a Houseboat

The sunlight playing over the emerald backwaters creating miniscule rainbows, an array of palm and coconut trees lining the banks, melodious songs of the birds filling the air, small children with large smiles waving at you, soft splashing sounds of the oars breaking the surface of the water, peace and calm seeping through the atmosphere into you. These are some of the small pleasures that will break a smile on your face and warmth in your hearts found only in the wonderland of Kerala.

Located on the south western coast of India in the Malabar region this enchanting land of beauty has captured the hearts of many. Commonly known as Gods Own Country this colourful cultured land with its rich heritage, magnificent landscapes and captivating backwaters is a destination where a holiday comes alive. Mostly this wonderful sate is frequented by tourists for the backwaters it has been blessed with. The backwaters found here are one of a kind and found nowhere else in the world and the best way to enjoy them is aboard a Kerala houseboat.

Get onboard on one of the Kerala houseboats and enjoy the slow, relaxing cruise along the alluring backwaters. One of the best backwaters to enjoy and flow along is found in Kumarakom. Lying nearby the village of Kottayam with the backdrop of Kerala’s largest freshwater lake; Vembanad, it is one of the backwaters that is frequented by tourists.

With Kumarakom houseboat packages enjoy a stay on the famed boathouses which comes equipped with all the basic amenities of life. The houseboats as the name suggests consists of bedrooms, kitchen, showers and all that you would find in a house. Basically these are floating houses and how many must have stayed in one before visiting Kerala. Meals are also served here that are cooked in the houseboat itself and possibly the fishes, prawns etc that may be served are caught in the very backwaters you are floating along.
The backwater of Kumarakom winds through the Vembanad Lake and the best part is there’s a bird sanctuary here. With Kumarakom tour packages you can visit the bird sanctuary where a large variety of migratory birds flock and this can be done on canoes that are found at the entrance of the sanctuary. Take a two hour long canoe trip at a low cost and make the best of your holiday. You can also opt for fishing, yachting, and other activities when here.

Get lost in the timeless enchanted backwaters absorbing the beauty as you flow along the backwater at natures pace. The panoramic view of the sun merging with the backwaters during twilights is a sight not to be missed. A modern tourist resort by the name of Taj Garden Retreat that was built by Alfred George Baker during the year 1881, the building is a two storied bungalow built on Teak rafters as a base.

The backwaters with its houseboats are just one of the numerous things that are found in this cultural land of Kerala. When you come to enjoy the backwaters you can also enjoy the lush green tea gardens of Munnar, see the age old cultural and colourful dance of Kathakali, witness a demonstration of Kalahari which is a form of martial arts, treat yourself to the awesome relaxing and rejuvenating massages with ayurvedic techniques. See the enigmatic and holy temples that have stood here blessing the lands with beauty, joy and peace. Come visit the land of emerald backwaters and exquisite house boats and take away a large catch of memories to last you a lifetime.
